instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: White line on screen - is this a board problem?
threads.message: A2141.  When I power this up, I get the power chime, but then all I'm seeing is this single horizontal white line across the bottom area of the screen as pictured.  I have connected this to an external display but I am not getting any output there.  Does this seem like a board issue or screen issue?  I would think if it were the screen, I'd still get output to the external display, no?

threads.title: White line on screen - is this a board problem?
threads.message:
"as pictured" where???

Tested external video disconnecting internal LCD?

threads.title: White line on screen - is this a board problem?
threads.message: I have not tested external video with the internal LCD disconnected.  Here is an edited picture showing the white line.

threads.title: White line on screen - is this a board problem?
threads.message: You should also try with known good (compatible) LCD assembly.
